scenarios.title: Test Scenario 1: Create Product
scenarios.description: This test demonstrates how to create a new product using a POST request. The request includes testing: true to indicate this is a test request.

requestPayload.name: Test Product
requestPayload.description: This is a test product created by the edge test page

checklistItems: Go to database and verify new product record was created
Check that 'name' field matches 'Test Product'
Check that 'price' field is 99.99
Check that 'status' field is 'active'
Verify 'testing' flag was set to true in the request
Check timestamp fields (createdAt, updatedAt)

scenarios.title: Test Scenario 2: Get Products by Category
scenarios.description: This test demonstrates how to retrieve products filtered by category using a GET request with select dropdown.
checklistItems: Select a category from the dropdown above
Click 'Test API Call' to execute the request
Verify API response contains only products with selected category
Check that all returned products have the correct category
Verify product count matches database count for that category

scenarios.title: Test Scenario 3: Get Product by ID
scenarios.description: This test demonstrates how to retrieve a specific product by ID using a GET request with product ID input field.
checklistItems: Enter a product ID in the input field above
Click 'Test API Call' to execute the request
Verify API response contains the product with specified ID
Check that response includes correct product ID
Verify all product fields are present in response

scenarios.title: Test Scenario 4: Update Product with Inputs
scenarios.description: This test demonstrates how to update an existing product using a PUT request with product ID input and status select dropdown.
checklistItems: Enter a product ID in the input field
Select a status from the dropdown
Click 'Test API Call' to execute the request
Go to database and find the updated product
Verify 'status' field was updated to selected value
Check that 'price' field was updated
Check that 'updatedAt' timestamp was updated
Verify 'testing' flag was included in the request
